posts._title: Dennis Cooper & Zac Farley – Like Cattle Towards Glow (2015)
posts.title: Like Cattle Towards Glow
posts.excerpt: Quote: The film’s violence is the genuinely spiritual kind. A loud expression of the alienation that hums constantly in the elevator music to modern life. (John Farley, Full Stop) The novels, writings and performance works created by prolific, transgressive and author Dennis Cooper describe a world in which desire, aggression, loneliness and power swirl, in …

posts._title: Jerzy Kawalerowicz – Austeria AKA The Inn (1982)
posts.title: Austeria
posts.excerpt: Quote: Austeria takes place during the opening days of World War I, in the Austro-Hungarian province of Galicia. Tag (Franciszek Pieczka) is a Jewish innkeeper whose inn (austeria means inn in the local Polish dialect) is located near the border with Russia. War has broken out and local civilians are fleeing the advancing Russian Army, …

posts.title: You’re Ugly Too
posts.excerpt: After her mother’s death, Stacey (Lauren Kinsella) moves with her uncle Will (Aiden Gillen) to a remote region in the Irish midlands. As the two cautiously get to know each other,they have to deal with the dark shadows of the past. An astute character driven study on the need to regain footing and let go, …

posts.title: Mondo Trasho
posts.excerpt: Mondo Trasho is a 1969 16mm mondo black comedy film by John Waters. The film stars Divine, Mary Vivian Pearce, David Lochary and Mink Stole. It contains very little dialogue, the story being told mostly through musical cues. A few excerpts from 1000misspenthours.com: ” In the meantime, what we can do is to revisit the …

posts._title: Les Blank & Skip Gerson – A Well Spent Life (1972)
posts.title: A Well Spent Life
posts.excerpt: Quote: Many people consider Texas bluesman Mance Lipscomb to be the greatest blues guitarist and songster of all time. This glowing portrait of the legendary musician (also life-long husband and sharecropper) is among Blank’s special masterworks. Instead of growing bitter, tough times made Lipscomb sweet. The favorite film of Kurt Vonnegutt, Jr.

posts._title: Anne Bogart & Holly Morris – The Babushkas of Chernobyl (2015)
posts.title: The Babushkas of Chernobyl
posts.excerpt: An affectionate portrait of a group of women who, after the 1986 Chernobyl disaster and evacuation, returned to the exclusion zone surrounding the nuclear power plant and have resided there – semi-officially, for years.

posts._title: Jean Epstein – Coeur fidèle AKA The Faithful Heart (1923)
posts.title: Coeur fidèle
posts.excerpt: Quote: In Coeur Fidèle’s accompanying 44-page booklet, Jean Epstein, at a 1924 address, argues his film as “romantic” rather than”realist”, the label with which Italian poet Ricciotto Canudo assigned it before his death. The truth is that Epstein’s largely unknown masterpiece provides a fascinating agreement of the two styles, oscillating with seamless precision between reverie …

posts._title: Will Tremper – Die endlose Nacht AKA The Endless Night (1963)
posts.title: Die endlose Nacht
posts.excerpt: esther-ofarim.de wrote: Film about people, who come to the airport and no airplane is flying.They are waiting and nothing happens. It’s a kind of criminal film with drama and comedy. Sandra Brennan (allmovie.com) wrote: This interesting film is set in Berlin’s Tempelhof airport during a bad storm. The airport is closed because of the weather, …

posts._title: Yuxin Zhuang – Ai qing de ya chi AKA Teeth of Love (2007)
posts.title: Ai qing de ya chi
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: An experienced TV drama screenwriter and a professor at the Beijing Film Academy, Zhuang Yuxin makes his debut feature Love Teeth in 2006, winning much applause from critics. Praised as the female version of the award-winning In the Heat of the Sun, Love Teeth also documents the rapid social and economic changes in Mainland …

posts.title: Hunter
posts.excerpt: Quote: Two friends return to their apartment after a night out to find a stranger passed out on their stoop. Intrigued, they vie for his attention over the rest of the weekend.
